meanings.sent1: The collateralities of the house were used to secure the loan.

meanings.definition: Something pledged as security for repayment of a loan.
meanings.sent1: He offered his car as collateralities for the loan.
meanings.sent2: The jewelry served as collateralities for the borrowed amount.
meanings.sent3: The rare painting was an unexpected collateralities for the loan.
meanings.sent4: The antique clock acted as a timeless collateralities for the loan.
meanings.sent5: The valuable stamp collection was a unique collateralities for the loan.

meanings.definition: A side effect or consequence of an action.
meanings.sent1: One of the collateralities of the new medication was drowsiness.
meanings.sent2: The collateralities of the decision were unforeseen at the time.
meanings.sent3: The collateralities of the prank left everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: The collateralities of the experiment led to an unexpected discovery.
meanings.sent5: The collateralities of the storm included a rainbow that brightened the sky.
